definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
step with the left foot (Kangxi radical 60)/see also 彳亍[chi4 chu4]
must not/may not/not to be allowed/cannot
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
to find out/to know/to learn about

sentences.english: It was easily good enough for pole so that was the main thing.
sentences.chinese: 那一圈跑得不错，足以使我获得杆位，那是最主要的。

sentences.english: Does she always dress that badly?
sentences.chinese: 她总是穿得那么邋遢的吗？

sentences.english: In this way Pingya's room had been fumigated before he was moved in.
sentences.chinese: 所以平亚搬进他的新屋子之前，也得要用烟熏。

sentences.english: Who make you mushroom so late, the whole ruddy blood temple you this hour equitable obtain up.
sentences.chinese: 谁让你起得这么晚，整个赤血宫就你这个时辰才起床。

sentences.english: The line was going out fast but steadily and the fish was not panicked.
sentences.chinese: 钓索朝水中溜得既快又稳，阐明这鱼并不受惊。

sentences.english: Get simply very dinkum , calm very thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 简单得很纯粹，平静得很彻底。

sentences.english: Get simply very dinkum , calm very thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 简单得很纯粹，平静得很彻底。

sentences.english: Many were asked, but few were able to answer.
sentences.chinese: 许多人被问到，可是很少人答得出来。

sentences.english: Still water and still religion freeze the quickest.
sentences.chinese: 一潭死水和死寂的宗教冰冻得最快。

sentences.english: I think you are too busy to take an afternoon off.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们真是忙得连个下午都抽不出来了。

sentences.english: He jazzed up the room with some bright red curtains.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些鲜红的窗帘将房间装饰得更具生气。

sentences.english: Without experiences in mind, he pledged he would never let his own two-year old son face such difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他发誓不会让自己两岁的儿子生活得那么艰辛。

sentences.english: The accuracy and precision of measurements from electrical meter were analyzed by statistical technique.
sentences.chinese: 以统计方法分析所量得含水率数值之准确性与精密性。

sentences.english: Mr Green has been out of work for several months and is on his uppers.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生失业好几个月了，现在已过得山穷水尽。

sentences.english: The clever thing was to break the rules and stay alive all the same .
sentences.chinese: 聪明的做法，是把规矩破得巧，同时又得活得好。

sentences.english: Later, those boats were heavily outrun by modern ships.
sentences.chinese: 稍后，那些船很重地根据现代船跑得更快。

definition: also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
